intro: Oxytropis tragacanthoides, commonly known as the Turk's Cap Locoweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces a distinctive seed pod that splits open to release its seeds. Oxytropis tragacanthoides is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments and is often found in disturbed soils.
